instruction: Move a selected object 10 units along the X axis
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object to move")
if obj:
    rs.MoveObject(obj, (10, 0, 0))

instruction: Move all objects on a specific layer to a new position
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
objs = rs.ObjectsByLayer("Layer 01")
if objs:
    rs.MoveObjects(objs, (0, 0, 10))

instruction: Rotate an object 45 degrees around the Z axis at the origin
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object to rotate")
if obj:
    rs.RotateObject(obj, (0,0,0), 45)

instruction: Rotate an object around a custom axis defined by two points
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object")
if obj:
    rs.RotateObject(obj, (0,0,0), 90, (0,0,1))

instruction: Scale an object uniformly by a factor of 2 from the origin
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object to scale")
if obj:
    rs.ScaleObject(obj, (0,0,0), (2,2,2))

instruction: Scale an object non-uniformly: 2x in X, 1x in Y, 0.5x in Z
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object")
if obj:
    rs.ScaleObject(obj, (0,0,0), (2, 1, 0.5))

instruction: Mirror an object across the YZ plane
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object to mirror")
if obj:
    rs.MirrorObject(obj, (0,0,0), (0,1,0), copy=True)

instruction: Mirror selected objects across a user-defined plane
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
objs = rs.GetObjects("Select objects to mirror")
if objs:
    p1 = rs.GetPoint("Start of mirror axis")
    p2 = rs.GetPoint("End of mirror axis")
    if p1 and p2:
        rs.MirrorObjects(objs, p1, p2, copy=True)

instruction: Apply a rotation transform using RhinoCommon
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc
import math

obj_id = sc.doc.Objects.GetObjectList(Rhino.DocObjects.ObjectType.AnyObject)
angle = math.radians(45)
xform = rg.Transform.Rotation(angle, rg.Vector3d.ZAxis, rg.Point3d.Origin)
for obj in sc.doc.Objects:
    sc.doc.Objects.Transform(obj.Id, xform, True)
sc.doc.Views.Redraw()

instruction: Scale geometry using a RhinoCommon transformation matrix
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

go = Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject()
go.SetCommandPrompt("Select objects to scale")
go.GetMultiple(1, 0)
if go.CommandResult() == Rhino.Commands.Result.Success:
    xform = rg.Transform.Scale(rg.Point3d.Origin, 2.0)
    for ref in go.Objects():
        sc.doc.Objects.Transform(ref.ObjectId, xform, True)
    sc.doc.Views.Redraw()

instruction: Create a linear array of a box: 5 copies spaced 12 units along X
Create a polar array of an object around the Z axis with 8 copies
Array objects along a curve at evenly spaced parameters
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select rail curve", 4)
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object to array")
if curve and obj:
    params = rs.DivideCurve(curve, 10)
    base = rs.ObjectAreaCentroid(obj) or rs.BoundingBox(obj)[0]
    for pt in params:
        vec = rs.VectorCreate(pt, base)
        rs.CopyObject(obj, vec)

instruction: Offset a selected curve by 2 units
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
if curve:
    rs.OffsetCurve(curve, (0,0,0), 2)

instruction: Offset a surface in its normal direction by 1 unit
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
srf = rs.GetObject("Select surface", 8)
if srf:
    rs.OffsetSurface(srf, 1.0)

instruction: Create concentric offset curves from a closed curve
Split a curve at a specific parameter
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
if curve:
    domain = rs.CurveDomain(curve)
    mid_param = (domain[0] + domain[1]) / 2
    rs.SplitCurve(curve, mid_param)

instruction: Join multiple curves into one polycurve
Split a surface with a cutting curve
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
srf = rs.GetObject("Select surface", 8)
cutter = rs.GetObject("Select cutting curve", 4)
if srf and cutter:
    rs.SplitBrep(srf, cutter)

instruction: Trim a curve using another intersecting curve as the cutter
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve to trim", 4)
cutter = rs.GetObject("Select cutting curve", 4)
if curve and cutter:
    rs.TrimCurve(curve, rs.CurveDomain(curve))

instruction: Fillet two intersecting curves with radius 3
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
c1 = rs.GetObject("First curve", 4)
c2 = rs.GetObject("Second curve", 4)
if c1 and c2:

instruction: Add fillets to all edges of a selected polysurface
Project a curve onto a surface
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
srf = rs.GetObject("Select surface", 8)
if curve and srf:
    projected = rs.ProjectCurveToSurface(curve, srf, (0,0,-1))
    if projected:
        print("Projected", len(projected), "curves")

instruction: Project points onto a surface along the Z direction
Rebuild a curve with a specific number of control points
code:

curve = rs.GetObject("Select curve", 4)
if curve:
    rs.RebuildCurve(curve, 3, 10)

instruction: Rebuild a surface to have uniform parameterization
code:

instruction: Orient an object from one plane to another
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object")
if obj:
    rs.OrientObject(obj, [(0,0,0),(1,0,0),(0,1,0)], [(5,5,5),(6,5,5),(5,6,5)])

instruction: Shear an object along the X axis
code:
import Rhino.Geometry as rg
import scriptcontext as sc
import Rhino

go = Rhino.Input.Custom.GetObject()
go.SetCommandPrompt("Select object to shear")
go.Get()
if go.CommandResult() == Rhino.Commands.Result.Success:
    xform = rg.Transform.Shear(rg.Plane.WorldXY, rg.Vector3d(0.5,0,0), rg.Vector3d(0,1,0), rg.Vector3d(0,0,1))
    sc.doc.Objects.Transform(go.Object(0).ObjectId, xform, True)
    sc.doc.Views.Redraw()

instruction: Copy an object and place it at a user-picked point
code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
obj = rs.GetObject("Select object to copy")
if obj:
    base = rs.GetPoint("Base point")
    target = rs.GetPoint("Target point")
    if base and target:
        vec = rs.VectorCreate(target, base)
        rs.CopyObject(obj, vec)

instruction: Explode a polysurface into individual surfaces
code:

obj = rs.GetObject("Select polysurface", 16)
if obj:
